results.author: Arshiya Chopra
results.content: The Indian Army on Monday issued a recruitment rally notification for Agniveers' recruitment under Agnipath scheme, stating that the registrations will begin from July 2022.  The notification comes amid the ongoing protests against the scheme across the country. "First rally for recruitment of Agniveer will start in mid August," PRO Kohima, Ministry Of Defence tweeted.
results.title: Indian Army issues notification for 'Agnipath' recruitment; registrations start from July

results.author: Anmol Sharma
results.content: Team India fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar has broken the record for winning most Player of the Series awards in international cricket by an Indian fast bowler. The 32-year-old bagged his fourth Player of the Series award after taking six wickets in the five-match T20I series against South Africa. He overtook Zaheer Khan and Ishant Sharma, who had won three each.
results.title: Bhuvneshwar breaks record for winning most Player of Series awards by an Indian pacer

results.author: Medhaa Gupta
results.content: Congress leader Sudip Roy Barman was hospitalised after he was allegedly attacked with bricks by a group of people in Tripura's Agartala, police said on Monday. The incident occurred when Barman, who is contesting in the upcoming state Assembly bypolls, was visiting a party worker's house, a police officer said. Tripura Congress claimed that BJP workers had "brutally attacked" Barman.
results.title: Tripura Congress leader Sudip Roy Barman attacked, party blames BJP

results.author: Shreyasi Banerjee
results.content: Over 50 people, including three Congress MLAs, were on Monday detained along the Singhu border between Delhi and Haryana amid protests against the Centre's Agnipath scheme. Congress MP Deepender S Hooda said Haryana Congress MLAs and leaders were on their way to take part in a peaceful protest demonstration. "Restriction on public expression is unacceptable in a democracy," Hooda added.
results.title: 3 Cong MLAs among 50 detained at Delhi border amid Agnipath protests

results.author: Ridham Gambhir
results.content: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has issued a notice to Indian Bank to withdraw its new recruitment rule that declared women with over three months of pregnancy "temporarily unfit" to join the bank. The bank added that candidates would be re-examined six weeks after their delivery for appointment in the bank. DCW called the bank's action "discriminatory and illegal".
results.title: 'Women pregnant over 3 months temporarily unfit,' says Indian Bank; DCW sends notice

results.author: Udit Gupta
results.content: Indian cricketer Mithali Raj, taking to Instagram on Monday, shared the trailer of the film 'Shabaash Mithu', which is based on her life. "One game, One nation, One ambition...My Dream! Grateful to...team and excited to share my story with you all," she wrote. The film, which will feature Taapsee Pannu in the lead role, has been directed by Srijit Mukherji.
results.title: Grateful to the team: Mithali Raj reacts to trailer of 'Shabaash Mithu'

results.author: Udit Gupta
results.content: Actress Aishwarya Sakhuja in an interview revealed that she suffered from Ramsay Hunt Syndrome eight years ago. This comes days after singer Justin Bieber revealed that he's suffering from facial paralysis due to the same disease. Aishwarya further said she managed to recover in a month, adding that she's sure Bieber will bounce back at the earliest too.
results.title: Bieber will bounce back too: Aishwarya Sakhuja on battling Ramsay Hunt Syndrome

results.author: Amartya Sharma
results.content: Khloe Kardashian has refuted rumours of dating an NBA player. Her fan page on Instagram questioned the dating rumours in a post. Responding to the post, Khloe wrote, "Definitely NOT True...I am not seeing a soul." "I am happy focusing on my daughter and myself for a while," Khloe further wrote. This comes after Khloe and Tristan Thompson broke up.
results.title: Definitely not true: Khloe Kardashian on rumours of dating NBA star

results.author: Amartya Sharma
results.content: Taking to Instagram Stories, Kim Kardashian shared pictures of Kanye West with their children. Along with the pictures, Kim wrote, "Thank you for being the best dad to our babies...loving them the way you do! Happy Father's Day Ye." Kim also shared a picture of Caitlyn Jenner and wrote, "Thank you for raising us and being the best stepdad."
results.title: Thank you for being best dad to our babies, Happy Father's Day Kanye: Kim

results.author: Saurabh Sinha
results.content: The influx of Ukrainian refugees could gradually ease labour shortages in the EU countries as many are likely to settle permanently, said the European Central Bank. It said the refugee crisis can lead to an increase of up to 13 lakh in the labour force in the eurozone. Around 70 lakh Ukrainians have reportedly fled their country since Russia's attack.
results.title: Ukrainian refugee influx to ease labour shortages in EU: ECB
